title: Does riot even care?
body:
I was having a conversation with a friend of mine about riot games and I thought it might be worth while to share it here.

Disclaimer:
I was not trying to get a punishment removed (the one I talk about is actually old as hell) but rather am trying to see the problems with the system in place addressed since there is currently zero protection options for this type of situation dealing with griefing or trolling in actions players aside of team communication however there is a very heavy chance you will also be reported for it.


Omg... That's ridiculous.. what kinda questions were you asking?
Mike
Asking for clarity and context in a situation
long story short their banning system is broken as hell
But they also refuse to address any of the subjects that make their system broken
Mallory
Uggghhh... I'm sorry you gotta deal with that.
Mike
Basicly I was punished for speaking out verse a player who was supposed to play support, their job was to help me out in bot lane and keep the enemy off me while leaving me the minions to kill
They took my minions, refused to ward so I could stop the enemy hiding in the bush next to us from killing us (so we could see them and shoot them from farther back without having to walk into the bush first) and did prettymuch everything they could to make my life hell
So I spoke out verse them telling them not to take my cs and that their job as support was not to carry lane or take over my lane but to ward and help me out and get me ahead
So that flame me and I get reported after the game by my team despite me playing legitimately while this guy who I'm forced to share a lane with is making my life hell
I'm behind like 100 minion kills, weak cuz I have no gold or items, I've died multiple times trying to 1v2 vs a annie who just camped in the bush in my lane while my support roams across the map
We ended up winning game cuz I just kept split pushing, they having 5v4 team fights and I'm off in a lane by myself taking objectives like towers so we win
But the point is that in that game the trolling player really fucked with us all and there was nothing we could do about it aside of use team communication... while they have a mute function to turn that team communication off if they don't want to hear it, they had protection while we had zero protection.
Mike
So my question to riot was if I'm being punished for team communication, what else can we do about trolling players if you don't want us to use the only option of team communication?

I then outlined how their suggestions don't work, either have a zero percent succuess rate or will see you punished.
Mike
I mean if you leave the game you get punished
If you mute the player nothing happens cuz it doesn't effect their actions
reporting them after the game doesn't effect their actions 10-20 mins previously
telling them what they are doing is reportable is in itself a offense you will be punished for (even tho its got a good chance to smarten your team up)
Leaving the game you will be punished for (I guess kinda successful cuz your not playing anymore or dealing with it)
The only option with a positive success rate aside of leaving the game is attempting player communication
Yet if you do there is a high chance that if your telling someone something to do or what not to do that you will be punished for it
So my question to them is what should a player do if all the options equal punishments or zero success rate?
Mallory
That's actually pretty fucked.
Mike
Yeah....
So.... They banned me from help desk and live chat for asking about that
Mallory
What kinda customer service is that... Wtfff
Mike
The kind that doesn't care about their customers lol
The kind from a company who deems themselves too big to fail
Mallory
That's some shit though.n
Mike
yuuup

replies.body:
You can't *force* someone to do what you want, and Riot isn't going to punish a player in the middle of the game because you don't like their strategy, which it very well might be rather than them trolling you; they aren't actually required to play a traditional/meta support role. Am I saying they weren't trolling? No, but it's impossible for me to determine that from here, so please entertain the idea that that isn't always their goal when they don't do what you want/expect. There's no need for you to "protect yourself" from someone playing off-meta, you can still adjust your playstyle and work with them if they are actually trying to win, and you are *their* teammate just as much as they are yours.

As for them "protecting themselves" from team communication...I'm not really getting what you think they are being protected from. It's not an attack unless you make it so. You say you are afraid of being reported for it; unless you're doing it wrong, as in you're being a jerk, it doesn't matter whether they report you or not. False reports like that do absolutely nothing.

Sometimes it will be a straight up troll just trying to piss people off or vent in a destructive way. We all have these games at some point if we play enough, but if we retaliate with negative or toxic behavior of our own, that just adds fuel to the fire. It can be frustrating for sure, but it's still possible to salvage the game or at least your enjoyment of it, if you try. They are held responsible for their actions just like every individual is for their own.

Did you actually read anything before you started typing?

Cuz I typed it out so the information could pass from one person to another, from me to you, but if you refuse to read it, how can you absorb the information and then reply on subject? You can't.. So why are you?

Nobody once said they wanted the right to force someone to do what they wanted.

But in saying that, are YOU saying that you support players who play support stealing cs and trying to take over the lane as the lane carry? You feel that is legitimate gameplay and that I'm in the wrong for telling my support to stop doing that?

We're gona disagree pretty largely on that one since one is legitimate gameplay and the other is not, one is working with the team as it should be while the other is griefing the team and putting them behind.. I'm sorry your so bias verse me that you cannot see this.

Thats your wrong Opinion that they are not punishable. You ARE entitled to that opinion however wrong it may be.

Toxic and negative are both subjective words, meaning that it requires someones opinion of a situation in order to exist. My opinion of what is negative or toxic may differ from your opinion and both of our opinions may differ from someone else's opinion.

If beauty is in the eye of the beholder, then the person who is observing gets to decide what is beautiful. A common saying is "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder," which means beauty doesn't exist on its own but is created by observers.

Anything they view as toxic or negative is. This is a concerning subject when you take into account the fact that riot staff take what your saying out of context by looking at a one sided conversation of you talking to yourself. This means anything from playful banter to legitimately pointing out a problem with a players actions or any legitimate part of the game can be taken as negative since they are again taking what your saying out of context, playful banter becomes one sided toxic activity if the staff views it that way due to toxic and negative being undefined and subjective, it fully depends on the opinion of the staff member viewing it.... And when most staff members skim looking for a way to post blame instead of actually trying to read or understand the situation, then your left with many missunderstandings that they will just assume are automatically toxic or negative due to their perspective and opinion on those subjective words.

Proof?

Below staff was 100% unable to tell the difference between the word "ME" and "team mate" or "you". If riot staff can't even read enough to see that I was using the word ME and due to that it was not directed at any other team mate, then how do you expect them to deal with any other situation legitimately when they are more complex then trying to get them to look at one word they refuse to stop skimming over? I mean they punished me for calling a report on another player when that was not reality due to them skimming and refusing to read, then tell me cuz another staff member punished me due to their own inability to read that nothing can be changed or overturned cuz a previous staff member already addressed it wrongly with a missunderstanding that I was calling for a report on someone else instead of the reality that I used the word "ME" that can in no way be directed towards any other members of the game.

Calling for a report is punishable due to it griefing your team mates... however I was not doing that... So I was punished then for griefing myself since they skimmed, assumed what I was about and then punished me for their assumptions while skimming, claiming that in their opinion I was griefing another player with this statement I was punished for... Yet we can clearly see that by saying ME I was not directing it at another player but rather myself in a joking way when another player called for a report on me.

Hey there,

I'm Iron Wing from Player Support. I see you've spoken to a few other agents, and now you've got another question. I'll try to address that new question, however I won't be able to contest or debate the chat restriction on this account.

In general, calling for reports for anyone is discouraged, and is usually drawing attention to negativity. Usually when I see this on other accounts, it's pulling focus away from the game, and directly on a disagreement between team members. This is distracting, and fans the flames in chat. Responding to others negativity in any way other than muting, is dangerous. It's far too easy to respond in such a way that can lead you to being punished as well.

These two facts conflict each other, THAT is why I brought up the FACT that they have protection while we do NOT have protection, since these are two conflicting issues since one is being punished despite the other having protection verse the text, while the other is often not punished despite there being zero protection verse their actions.

You understand that? They can grief and troll in peace if they want by just using the PROTECTION in place called mute so they don't have to hear their team trying to talk them out of doing what they are doing, or convince them to do something they should be doing. You've gone one step farther by PROTECTING players who use mute and don't want their team ~Who cannot communicate with them~ from using the last form of communication, pings, cuz trolls and griefers dislike people spamming question marks on them IN A ATTEMPT TO GET THEM TO SMARTEN UP.

Its called cause and effect, it means that in order to have a effect, there needs to be something causing this, this means that in order for a player in game to stop playing the game and then type on their keyboard, there would have to be something that triggered that, or a cause. Most times this is another player that cause's this and the effect is that players type to them in order to get them to stop the action they shouldn't be doing or to start doing a action they should be doing. Nobody is talking about meta or not meta, you could be play any off meta support you want, the job remains the same, the expectations from your team mate remain the same.. so I'm clueless on why you think this is a meta vs off meta issue when its a trolling+griefing vs team communication issue.

The entire goal since this punishment happened was to try and make riot admit that there isn't many options for players in situations with trolling or griefing team mates and out of the options they suggest (mute and report after game) nether of them actually equal any kind of a solution since mute doesn't effect players actions and report after game doesn't change a players actions 10-20 mins previously.
